explanation: MISRA C:2023 R.8.13 requires pointers to point to const-qualified types whenever the pointed-to object is not modified. The try_match_header function takes char *line but only reads from the characters (tests *line, advances the pointer, calls MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ and strdup on &line[prefix_len]) and never writes through the pointer. Therefore the parameter should be declared const char *line. Changing the prototype to use const char *line (and updating its callers, which may pass a char * without problem) fixes the violation. The actual mutation of the buffer (buf[newline] = '\0') happens in process_multipart_headers before the call, but that does not justify a non-const parameter because callers may pass mutable memory to a function that only needs read access. In short: the agent A report is correct — the code (try_match_header signature) violates R.8.13.
